Issues.Title: Expose `IMAGE_CONFIG` provider in Angular v14
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Based on the [Angular docs](https://angular.io/guide/image-directive#responsive-images), one can customize the breakpoints using the `IMAGE_CONFIG` token. However, when latest changes on `NgOptimizedImage` landed on v14.3.0, it doesn't include the export for this token as shown in this code https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/14.3.0/packages/common/src/common.ts#L30

In v15+, it's already exported: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/15.2.9/packages/common/src/common.ts#L30

Issues.Title: provideServerRendering() and provideHttpClient() ordering issue
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

platform-server

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Currently, when you want to configure HttpClient differently on the server, adding the `provideHttpClient(...)` call in front of the `provideServerRendering()` has no effect. The problem is that the `provideServerRendering()` under the hood adds the `provideHttpClient()` call, which effectively overrides any custom configuration of HttpClient, see:

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/06b498f67f2ad16bb465ef378bdb16da84e41a1c/packages/platform-server/src/provide_server.ts#L32

This was done for historical reasons to mimic the ServerModule class that imported the HttpClientModule.

The solution is to move the `provideHttpClient(...)` *after* the `provideServerRendering()` call.

Since there is no indication that the configuration was overridden, this leads to hard to debug situations.

I think there are 2 possible options:

- Ideally, we should probably drop the `provideHttpClient()` from the `provideServerRendering()` implementation, especially since we merge the client and server configs on the server (in the `app.config.server.ts`). We can only do that in v17 though, since it would be breaking.
- As a possible solution, we can add some dev-mode only code that would use a trick like the one used with `ROUTER_IS_PROVIDED` and output a warning to mention that custom HttpClient configuration was overridden. We can try to do it in the interim before v17.

// cc @alan-agius4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "provideServerRendering() and provideHttpClient() ordering issue " (#50454)

Issues.Title: refactor: resolve all circular dependency exceptions
Issues.Body:
The circular deps test protects against real, runtime circular dependencies but will pick up false positives when a cycle only exists at the type level. Angular has a number of such type-only cycles, which were listed as exceptions in a circular deps golden file.

Having these exceptions is undesirable, because they can prevent *real* circular dependencies from being caught by the test. This commit clears all current exceptions by leveraging a recent change to circular dep testing: the test now understands `import type` syntax and does not consider such imports as contributing to import cycles.

`import type` is used to mark imports that were involved in prior cycles in a way that satisfies the circular dep test. All existing entries in the golden file are resolved via this technique.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: resolve all circular dependency exceptions" (#50453)

Issues.Body:

### Is this a regression?

### Description

Hello,

Seems like a fairly common case but haven't been able to find a similar post.
(except for the following link but no docu link or explanation: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42465003/async-validators-causing-expression-has-changed-error)

Issues.Title: Deprecate @Host(), @Inject(), @Optional(), @Self() & @SkipSelf()
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

Considering TypeScript 5's support for ES Decorators which do not currently support parameter decorators, we could deprecate all parameter decorators and recommend the usage of `inject()` instead.

This would allow us to safely disable experimental decorators in the future.

### Proposed solution

Deprecate parameter decorators.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Deprecate @Host(), @Inject(), @Optional(), @Self() & @SkipSelf()" (#50439)

Issues.Title: Stackblitz URL pattern in Start tutorial wrong
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

The [*Managing Data* part of the *Start* tutorial](https://angular.io/start/start-data#set-up-the-cart-component) described the following:

> ... the URL has the pattern https://getting-started.stackblitz.io/cart, where getting-started.stackblitz.io may be different for your StackBlitz project.

This is not true.
The URL doesn't change.
In a *normal* local development (in a *normal* browser) this would probably be true.
But in stackblitz specifically the URL doesn't change.

## Suggested Docs Change (1)
Just remove the second part of the sentence.
Result:
> Verify the new CartComponent works as expected by clicking the Checkout button. You can see the "cart works!" default text.

## Suggested Docs Change (2)
> Verify the new CartComponent works as expected by clicking the Checkout button. You can see the "cart works!" default text. In a browser (other than the one from StackBlitz) the URL would have the pattern `https://domain.com/cart` 

If one of the suggestions get accepted, I'd be happy to change the docs accordingly.

Issues.Title: Signals - Extended Detection + Testability
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

The main usability issue with the `effect` for signals, in my view - restrictions of the `effect` implementation that requires for each signal to execute on the initial run, or else the change may not be detected.

It is quite normal to have methods of the class making use of internal signals, and then those methods can be used inside your `effect` handler. However, if your method uses signals conditionally, which is quite normal, they won't execute on the initial run, and then the change detection won't work correctly.

### Proposed solution

This issue can be addressed from two sides - interface extension, for the run-time, and/or test-mode provisions.

We can add manual/override extension on what signals trigger the `effect` execution, by extending `CreateEffectOptions` with the following:

* Option `signals` - optional array of signals that can trigger the `effect` execution.
* Option `policy` / `strategy` - defines how `signals` option is to be treated:
   * `add` (default) - specified list of `signals` is an addition to the ones that `effect` execution detects.
   * `replace` - the `effect` won't be tracking signals from its execution, and instead execute `effect` when any of the specified signals trigger
   * `match` - on the initial run and signal detection, `effect` will compare the list of triggered signals versus the list specified, and should the two sets not match, an error is to be thrown. This is primarily for automated tests.

### Alternatives considered

In addition, and partially instead, `EffectRef` should provide a protocol for subscribing to (at least) the initial run, and report (as parameters) the list of signals that triggered.

This in itself is quite necessary, and also, if implemented, will let us simplify the `policy` option above to just an `add/replace` boolean, as `match` will no longer be needed (though a nice-have addition), as tests can check the list of signals triggered during the initial run.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Signals - Extended Detection + Testability" (#50435)

Issues.Title: Scss error after upgrading to Angular 15
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I have an app which uses [@momentum-ui/core](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@momentum-ui/core), after upgrading to Angular 15 it's throwing the error below when running `npm start`. 

I know in Angular 13 tilde in Scss was deprecated but we're only seeing this error with Angular 15. Did something happen during 15 which might have caused this error? I can't seem to see anything in the change log which might indicate this.

After messing around with the minimal reproduction repo below I managed to get it to compile successfully by removing 2 specific Scss tildes in node_modules/@momentum-ui/core, there are other tildes still present.  I have specified which ones exactly in the repo in app.component.html. I also had to use @ use instead of @ import like they mention under the usage section of their [npm page](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@momentum-ui/core). 

So it looks like a Scss tilde issue but how come we are seeing it now and are there any work around in the mean time?


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/shammy8/test-momentum-core-with-angular-15

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
./src/styles.scss - Error: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/sass-loader/dist/cjs.js):
SassError: SassError: Error: The "path" argument must be of type string. Received an instance of TypeError
  ╷
6 │ @import "@momentum-ui/core/scss/momentum-ui";
  │         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  ╵
  src\styles.scss 6:9  root stylesheet

./src/styles.scss?ngGlobalStyle - Error: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/mini-css-extract-plugin/dist/loader.js):
HookWebpackError: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/sass-loader/dist/cjs.js):
SassError: SassError: Error: The "path" argument must be of type string. Received an instance of TypeError
  ╷
5 │ @import "@momentum-ui/icons/scss/momentum-ui-icons.scss";
  │         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  ╵
  src\styles.scss 5:9  root stylesheet
```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 15.2.8
Node: 16.17.0
Package Manager: npm 8.15.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 15.2.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
```

## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)

## What is the current behavior?

When running the builder in watch mode, and fetching the git repo that the project is contained in, any changes in the .git folder trigger a rebuild. This is especially annoying when the IDE that you use periodically fetches the repository, and the FETCH_HEAD file triggers the rebuild every time. 

Issue Number: N/A

## What is the new behavior?

With this change the .git folder will be ignored in the watcher

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): watch all TypeScript referenced files in esbuild builder
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder in watch mode, all files referenced by the TypeScript program are now watched in additional to files within the project root. This allows for more extensive monorepo setups to take advantage of watch mode as TypeScript files may exist in other library projects within the repository.

Issues.Title: assets entry for the build-angular does not support yarn pnp package paths?
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

It does not appear to be possible to include assets and paths from a yarn pnp package. 

It seems that build-angular builder supports pnp package resolution for styles, but not assets. 

I would expect the assets path (dictionary specification option) to work to copy paths from pacakges in the pnp environment. 

### Minimal Reproduction

% ng new test-yarn-example --style scss --no-routing
% cd test-yarn-example 
% yarn add ng2-pdfjs-viewer 

Next, add the path to the angular.json. 

Just adding the string will result in the error saying it must be in the project source root.

Adding the dictionary version, yields no error but does not copy the assets either. 

```
     {
                "glob": "**/*",
                "input": "node_modules/ng2-pdfjs-viewer/pdfjs",
                "output": "/assets/pdfjs"
     }
```
% yarn build


### Exception or Error

```text
Unable to copy assets: The ng2-pdfjs-viewer/node_modules/pdfjs asset path must start with the project source root.
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 16.0.2
Node: 18.15.0
Package Manager: yarn 3.5.0
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 16.0.2
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1600.2 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.0.2
@angular-devkit/core            16.0.2 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.0.2 (cli-only)
@schematics/angular             16.0.2 (cli-only)
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.0.4
```

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/core): use package exports field for secondary entries
Issues.Body: The secondary entry point (`node`) within the `@angular-devkit/core` package is now defined by an exports entry in the main package.json file for the package. This removes the need for the additional nested package.json file in a subdirectory. The exports field also contains backward compatible entries to allow for continued deep imports into the package. These compatibility entries will, however, be removed in a future major version. Deep imported files are not considered part of the public API of the package.

Issues.Title: refactor: disable Webpack `topLevelAwait`
Issues.Body:
Webpack enabled top level await by default in version 5.83.0. (See: https://github.com/webpack/webpack/releases/tag/v5.83.0)

This commit restores the previous behaviour, as top level await is not supported due to Zone.js issues.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor: disable Webpack `topLevelAwait`" (#25245)

Issues.Title: build: minor cleanup of bazel build rules
Issues.Body: BUILD files for each package have had outdated glob excludes removed. Additionally, some src args have been reduced to a single file where possible. The root bazel ignore file has also been expanded to include all node module directories in each package. The ignore file does not appear to currently support globs so each path has been individually specified.

Issues.Title: Automatically --skip-confirmation when no terminal detected
Issues.Body:
### Command

add

### Description

When using git bash for Windows, and trying to do an add, I get this:

> No terminal detected. '--skip-confirmation' can be used to bypass installation confirmation. Ensure package name is correct prior to '--skip-confirmation' option usage.


### Describe the solution you'd like

I'd like a way to set a global config saying if I'm doing an `ng add` and there's no terminal detected, that it just automatically skips confirmation.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

Issues.Title: Ng new still uses Karma framework while Karma is deprecated
Issues.Body:
### Command

new, test

### Is this a regression?

- N/A

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

N/A

### Description

Executing: `ng new <project>` will give you a new Angular project. Which still uses [Karma](https://github.com/karma-runner/karma) in it's `angular.json` file. However, Karma is **deprecated**. Please, move to another project by default (eg. Jest). Meaning that executing `ng test` will still use Karma.

See your own post: https://blog.angular.io/moving-angular-cli-to-jest-and-web-test-runner-ef85ef69ceca

Avoid that new projects are using deprecated tools/projects at the start of their project. 


### Minimal Reproduction

- `ng new test`
- `cd test`
- `ng test`

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 16.0.2
Node: 18.16.0
Package Manager: npm 9.5.1
OS: linux x64

Angular: 16.0.2
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1600.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.0.2
@angular-devkit/core            16.0.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.0.2
@schematics/angular             16.0.2
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.0.4
```


### Anything else relevant?

Understand the important of a good unit test framework, use the latest tools, and **practice what you preach**. 

Please, if that is all updated, update also your docs: https://angular.io/guide/testing#set-up-testing. Finally, you could help users by migrating to Jest via: https://github.com/briebug/jest-schematic. Which can also be documented in your guide.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Ng new still uses Karma framework while Karma is deprecated" (#25250)

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
```

Issues.Title: ng serve with esbuild does not deliver assets when project directory contains URL-encoded entity
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I stumbled upon this issue in a project with a space in its name on the repository server (when cloning via HTTPS, the "%20" from the checkout URL remains part of the workspace directory name). This sure isn't ideal, but everything works, except for serving assets (i.e., favicon, _assets_ folder) with the esbuild builder for ng serve: The assets are not served and will instead return 404.

### Minimal Reproduction

1. `mkdir repo%20sitory`
1. `cd repo%20sitory`
1. `ng new app`
1. `cd app`
1. (change _angular.json_ to include esbuild builder)
1. `ng serve`
1. _favicon.ico_ will 404

Renaming `repo%20sitory` to `repository` fixes the issue.

### Exception or Error

```text
All assets are not served, and requests will return a 404 error response. They are copied properly when running `ng build` though.
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 16.0.1
Node: 16.18.1
Package Manager: npm 8.19.2
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 16.0.1
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1600.1
@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.0.1
@angular-devkit/core            16.0.1
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.0.1
@schematics/angular             16.0.1
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.0.4
```

(Also happens on Windows.)

### Anything else relevant?

The `%20` is URL-decoded somewhere along the line: The server will even attempt to load the file from the (URL-decoded) `repo sitory` directory in the file system until vite jumps in and disallows serving this file from outside the project folder, resulting in a 403 error response.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ng serve with esbuild does not deliver assets when project directory contains URL-encoded entity" (#25238)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): percent encode asset URLs in development server for esbuild
Issues.Body:
When using the esbuild-based browser application builder with the development server, configured application assets are served directly from disk. The URLs passed to Vite are now percent encoded to properly handle asset paths that may contain unsupported URL characters. This aligns with the static middleware within Vite: https://github.com/vitejs/vite/blob/3609e79dc1416073dc4775bb2fcf6a7398f169b3/packages/vite/src/node/server/middlewares/static.ts#L162

Closes #25238
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): percent encode asset URLs in development server for esbuild" (#25239)

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>Microsoft/tslib</summary>

### [`v2.5.2`](https://togithub.com/microsoft/tslib/releases/tag/2.5.2): tslib 2.5.2

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/Microsoft/tslib/compare/2.5.1...2.5.2)

This release [explicitly re-exports helpers](https://togithub.com/microsoft/tslib/pull/204) to work around TypeScript's incomplete symbol resolution for tslib.

### [`v2.5.1`](https://togithub.com/microsoft/tslib/releases/tag/2.5.1): tslib 2.5.1

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/Microsoft/tslib/compare/2.5.0...2.5.1)

This release of tslib provides fixes for two issues.

First, [it reverses the order of `init` hooks provided by decorators](https://togithub.com/microsoft/tslib/pull/202) to correctly reflect proposed behavior.

Second, it [corrects the `exports` field of tslib's `package.json` and provides accurate declaration files](https://togithub.com/microsoft/tslib/pull/202) so that it may be consumed under the `node16` and `bundler` settings for `moduleResolution.`

</details>

Issues.Title: NG6002: Appears in the NgModule.imports of AppModule, but could not be resolved to an NgModule class.
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I have a library built with Angular 11 https://github.com/jasonliao-cb/oneiam-js-library, but it seems not compatible with Angular Ivy. I have tried all the settings and commands, but I still can't make it work for Ivy. Is there anything I missed or I can't make it a library compatible with Ivy this way? please suggest.

### Minimal Reproduction

just import it in an application built by Angular 12 or higher https://github.com/jasonliao-cb/oneiam-demo, and when running: ng serve, the error comes.

if import the package from source code, it works without any error.

### Exception or Error

```text
Error: node_modules/@cb/oneiam/angular/module.d.ts:3:22 - error NG6002: Appears in the NgModule.imports of AppModule, but could not be resolved to an NgModule class.

This likely means that the library (@cb/oneiam/angular) which declares OneiamModule has not been processed correctly by ngcc, or is not compatible with Angular Ivy. Check if a newer version of the library is available, and update if so. Also consider checking with the library's authors to see if the library is expected to be compatible with Ivy.

3 export declare class OneiamModule {
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 12.2.18
Node: 12.22.12
Package Manager: npm 6.14.16
OS: darwin x64
```


### Anything else relevant?

the library project uses Webpack to build.

Issues.Title: feat(mat-tab): ability to set mat-tab height to grow to fill available area within mat-tab-group
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Currently, the best solution I've found is to override:

`::ng-deep .mat-mdc-tab-body-wrapper { flex-grow: 1; }`

See this [reproduction](https://stackblitz.com/edit/1kawpj?file=src%2Fexample%2Ftab-group-basic-example.html,src%2Fexample%2Ftab-group-basic-example.scss).

If `flex-grow: 1` was added to the body wrapper or an API option provided that allowed that behaviour without using `::ng-deep`, that would be great. Thanks.

### Use Case

Situations where I want a tab group to occupy the full height available and have its contents expand to the available height. E.g. a table or text editing component inside a tab that is scrollable but should occupy as much of the height available as possible.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(mat-tab): ability to set mat-tab height to grow to fill available area within mat-tab-group" (#27162)

```
<mat-form-field class="example-full-width">
  <mat-label>Choose a date</mat-label>
  <input matInput [matDatepickerFilter]="myFilter" [matDatepicker]="picker">
  <mat-hint>MM/DD/YYYY</mat-hint>
  <mat-datepicker-toggle matIconSuffix [for]="picker"></mat-datepicker-toggle>
  <mat-datepicker #picker></mat-datepicker>
</mat-form-field>
```
where,
```
myFilter = (d: Date | null): boolean => {
    const day = (d || new Date()).getDay();
    // Prevent Saturday and Sunday from being selected.
    return day !== 0 && day !== 6;
  };
```
Above snippet is an example which will prevent user from selecting saturday and sunday. However the description for it below says,

> In this example the user can back past 2005, but all of the dates before then will be unselectable. They will not be able to go further back in the calendar than 2000. If they manually type in a date that is before the min, after the max, or filtered out, the input will have validation errors.

Please refer the Screenshot below,
![image](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/24619269/3558c557-e50c-47cd-8e1c-6de323cca732)

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/overview#date-validation
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs(material/datepicker): description below the example for matDatepickerFilter not correct" (#27159)

Issues.Title: google-maps web component support
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

The Google maps team has announced web components for both the map and advanced marker functionality.  With more to be added.

[Announcement blog](https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/maps-platform/build-maps-faster-web-components)

It is currently in preview and available to use by appending "v=beta" (with some caveats like currently you must have a map-id).


## Feature Request

Slim utility directives to aid in using these webcomponents in Angular.

 Will help with:

- google-maps api loading (remove the need to use httpclient jsonp backend and simplify usage)
- Access to the webcomponent instance to be easily used with `@ViewChild` etc.
- Set google-map options like the current Angular component. Currently setting individual props is a pain with the web components.

## Why?

From what I can tell from the source code the Angular Google Maps components are wrappers around the "native" Google maps api, abstracting the creation and adding an Angular sugar to the interactions (events, inputs).

- Using the web components removes the need for this creation abstraction, simplifying maintenance and code base.

- Angular natively already plays well with web components' events and prop binding.

I have already been playing around with this idea and it seems to work well.

If this is something the team thinks would be a good feature I will flesh out my work and post an example here.

I am also happy to take on this feature 😊 

### Use Case

A more easy plug and play experience with Google Maps webcomponents.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "google-maps web component support" (#27155)

Issues.Title: bug(checkbox): Tri-state checkbox runs out of sync with its input after a change event
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I think the direct implementation with the `(change)` checkbox output (represented in https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-tzjh4u?file=src%2Fmain.ts) has never worked.

With the Legacy checkbox, we had a workaround that relied on `click` and `keyup.space` DOM events instead of relying on the component's `change` output.
After migrating to MDC, this workaround no longer works, too.



### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-tzjh4u?file=src%2Fmain.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click checkbox to toggle between "checked" and "unchecked" - see how the checkbox state (checkmark) is always in sync with the app  state (`this.state`)
2. Click the "Set to indeterminate" button
3. Click the checkbox, which is currently in the indeterminate state


### Expected Behavior

Checkbox becomes "unchecked"

### Actual Behavior

Checkbox becomes "checked", despite `this.state` is "unchecked". Checkbox is now out of sync with its input. Note how `ng-reflect-checked="false"`, while the classname includes `mat-mdc-checkbox-checked`

### Environment

- Angular 16.0.2
- CDK/Material: 16.0.1
- Browser(s): Firefox, Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(checkbox): Tri-state checkbox runs out of sync with its input after a change event" (#27150)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-slider): current value out of sync with form value
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Current value of the slider can be out of sync between the actual form value and the view.

### Reproduction

[Minimal reproduction on Stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-rp3ric?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html,src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.ts).

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open up the stackblitz repro
2. Look at the example-component.ts file
3. Read the whole comment explaining what's expected
4. In the view, click next button twice to end up in wrong state (all explained in details in stackblitz as a comment)

When updating the form value, the current value in the view should be the correct one.

### Actual Behavior

Issues.Title: bug(MatList): matListItemMeta forces color onto any element under it
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.3.0

### Description

After the material migration to Angular 15, we have lost the ability to freely change the color elements within the matListItemMeta directive. 

This means that if you put two buttons in an element of the list, one enabled and one disabled, they will both appear to be of the same color. This makes buttons appear disabled even when they're not.

Of course this directive didn't exist in Angular 14, but it is the only place to put these elements in this version.

I understand this might have been on purpose as it appears that this section might only be intended for text, but it makes a great drawer for buttons that perform actions on elements of the list, and it used to work perfectly for this.

### Reproduction

This happens both in Angular 15 and 16

Angular 15:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-gvbxke?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html

Angular 16:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-16-material-starter-upzbq5?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.module.ts,src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html

### Expected Behavior

When putting buttons or icons inside the matListItemMeta they should keep their color.

### Actual Behavior

When putting buttons or icons inside the matListItemMeta they change their color to grey (same exact color as a disabled button), affecting the usability of buttons.

### Environment

- Angular: 15&16
- CDK/Material: 15.2.9 (latest)
Package Manager: npm 8.19.2
- Operating System : Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatList): matListItemMeta forces color onto any element under it" (#27144)

Issues.Title: feat(mat-select): Allow values to be displayed that are not included in the options list
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

We would like to show a value as "selected" only on the closed mat-select/mat-select-trigger that is not included in the available options list. 

Here is an example that tries to achieve this. 
https://stackblitz.com/edit/wmjgwt
If you change selectable to true (line 37) of select-overview-example.ts the viewValue and backgroundColor are shown in the closed mat-select as expected. Setting it to false shows only the backgroundColor but not the viewValue. We like to see the viewValue as well.

### Use Case

a) Imagine a process A -> B -> C with a strict order and tasks following this process. Now you have a mat-select showing the current process step B and if you open the select box it should only show step C as available option. Currently the closed mat-select shows nothing, the opened mat-select shows step C.

b) Imagine a permission system where the user is allowed to select some options of a select box an some not. Here we could use the disabled option. But to make it easier for the user, not showing the options at all would also be handy.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(mat-select): Allow values to be displayed that are not included in the options list" (#27142)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-select): disabled option doesn't work in legacy version
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

V13

### Description

`<mat-select (openedChange)="openChanged($event)" [formControl]="appselect" [disabled]="true" (selectionChange)="selectionChangedTrigger($event)">`

The code above would disable the mat-select component in v13.
We've switched to angular v15 but still using the legacy version of Angular Material.

What I've seen is that the 'mat-form-field-disabled' is no longer present in the generated html.
`<mat-form-field _ngcontent-wjb-c202="" appearance="fill" class="mat-form-field w-100 ng-tns-c112-11 mat-primary ng-star-inserted mat-form-field-type-mat-select mat-form-field-appearance-fill mat-form-field-can-float mat-form-field-has-label ng-touched ng-pristine ng-valid mat-form-field-should-float">`

I know this is a legacy version, so it is unlikely that this will be fixed.
But can you confirm that this indeed in a bug and that it's not me doing something wrong?



### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Have Angular-Material V15 legacy
2. Add a <mat-select> with [disabled]="true"
3. The mat-select dropdown is not disabled in runtime


### Expected Behavior

A disabled dropdown 

### Actual Behavior

The dropdown is still accessible

### Environment

- Angular: V15
- CDK/Material: V15 using the legacy components
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 11

Angular CLI: 15.1.6
Node: 18.12.1
Package Manager: npm 8.19.2
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 15.1.5
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... localize, material, material-moment-adapter
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
